intro: Spiralepis, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant typically features compound leaves with a feathery appearance, and its flowers are small and clustered. Spiralepis is native to tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
